title: Agent Interfaces & Contracts: How Agents Communicate Safely
intent: Understand how agents should communicate with other agents and systems using strict contracts instead of free text.

core_idea.one_liner: Agents must talk like APIs, not like humans.

definition.agent_interface: A formally defined input/output contract that governs how an agent receives requests and returns results.

micro_example.scenario: Planner agent delegates to RCA agent
micro_example.bad: Hey, can you check why this is slow?
micro_example.good: Structured request with intent, scope, and constraints.

failure_modes: Overloading one interface with multiple meanings
guards: All agent interactions must use contracts.

teach_it_in_english.simple_explanation: Agents should communicate the same way services do.
teach_it_in_english.one_sentence_definition: Agent interfaces turn cooperation into engineering.
